intro: Blakeochloa rodwayi, commonly known as the rodway's blakeochloa, is a grass species native to the southern United States. It is characterized by its fine, narrow leaves and compact growth habit. This plant typically thrives in well-drained soils and full sun conditions. It is often found in open areas such as prairies and disturbed sites. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
